csoundengine
  • »
  • Reference
  • View page source

Reference¶

Introduction¶

At the core of the csoundengine library is the Engine class, which wraps a csound process. This class provides a simple way to start and communicate with csound, define instruments, schedule events, etc. The interaction is very transparent and any .csd script can be adapted to be run using an Engine.

The Session class implements a high-level interface. It builds on top of Engine. Both an Engine and its associated Session are conceived to run in real-time. See Renderer for offline rendering

csoundengine Package¶

csoundengine¶

csoundengine implements a simple interface to run and control a csound process.

from csoundengine import Engine
# create an engine with default options for the platform
engine = Engine()
engine.defInstr('''
  instr synth
    kmidinote = p4
    kamp = p5
    kcutoff = p6
    kfreq = mtof:k(kmidinote)
    asig = vco2:a(kamp, kfreq)
    asig = moogladder2(asig, kcutoff, 0.9)
    aenv = linsegr:a(0, 0.1, 1, 0.1, 0)
    asig *= aenv
    outs asig, asig
  endin
''')
# start a synth with indefinite duration
event = engine.sched("synth", args=[67, 0.1, 3000])

# any parameter can be modified afterwords:
# change midinote
engine.setp(event, 4, 67)

# modify cutoff
engine.setp(event, 6, 1000, delay=4)

# stop the synth:
engine.unsched(event)

A higher level layer (Session) allows a more ergonomic interface, with features like named arguments for instruments, default values for arguments, the possibility to schedule an instrument after or before another instrument to build process chains, built-in instruments to play a sample from disk/memory, offline rendering, etc.

from csoundengine import *

# create an Engine and a corresponding Session with default options
session = Engine().session()

# create a master audio channel
session.engine.initChannel("master", kind='a')

# define instruments
session.defInstr("synth", r'''
  |ibus, kmidi=60, kamp=0.1, ktransp=0, ifade=0.5|
  asig vco2 kamp, mtof:k(kmidi+ktransp)
  asig *= linsegr:a(0, ifade, 1, ifade, 0)
  busout(ibus, asig)
''')

session.defInstr("filter", r'''
  |ibus, kcutoff=1000, kresonance=0.9|
  asig = busin(ibus)
  asig = moogladder2(asig, kcutoff, kresonance)
  chnmix(asig, "master")
''')

session.defInstr("master", r'''
  asig = chnget:a("master")
  asig compress2 asig, asig, -120, -40, -12, 3, 0.1, 0.01, 0.05
  outch 1, asig
  chnclear("master")
''')

# start a master instance at the end of the evaluation chain
master = session.sched("master", priority=10)

dur = 5
for i, midinote in enumerate(range(60, 72, 2)):
    # for each synth, we create a bus to plug it to an effect, in this case a filter
    bus = session.newBus()
    # start time for synth and effect
    start = i * 1
    # Schedule a synth
    synth = session.sched("synth", delay=start, dur=5, kmidi=midinote, ibus=bus.busnum)
    # Automate the transposition of the pitch so that it goes 2 semitones
    synth.automatep('ktransp', [0, 0, dur, -2], delay=start)
    # Schedule the filter for this synth, with a priority higher than the
    # synth, so that it is evaluated later in the chain
    filt = session.sched("filter", delay=start, dur=5, priority=synth.priority+1,
        kcutoff=2000, kresonance=0.92, ibus=bus.busnum,
        whenfinished=lambda p1, bus=bus: bus.free())
    # Automate the cutoff freq. of the filter
    filt.automatep('kcutoff', [0, 2000, dur*0.8, 500, dur, 6000], delay=start)

Classes¶

Engine([name, sr, ksmps, backend, outdev, …])

Create a csound Engine, which controls an underlying csound process.

Instr(name, body[, args, init, tabledef, …])

An Instr is a template used to schedule a concrete instrument at a Session or a Renderer.

Renderer([sr, nchnls, ksmps, a4, …])

A Renderer is used when rendering offline.

csoundengine.session Module¶

This module provides a high-level interface to control un underlying csound process. The core is a Session, which is associated with an Engine (there can be only one Session per Engine) and enables following features:

  • Declaration of instrument templates which are independent of their order of evaluation (Instr)

  • pfields default values and names

  • Associated parameter table. An Instr can define a table with named slots. This can be used to exchange information with a specific instrument instance

  • Inline pfield declaration

Example

s = Engine().getSession()
Intr('sine', r'''
    kfreq = p5
    kamp = p6
    a0 = oscili:a(kamp, kfreq)
    outch 1, a0
''').register(s)
synth = s.sched('sine', kfreq=440, kamp=0.1)
synth.stop()

An Instr can define default values for any of its p-fields:

s = Engine().getSession()
Intr('sine', args={'kamp': 0.1, 'kfreq': 1000, body=r'''
    kamp = p5
    kfreq = p6
    a0 = oscili:a(kamp, kfreq)
    outch 1, a0
''').register(s)
# We schedule an event of sine, kamp will take the default (0.1)
synth = s.sched('sine', kfreq=440)
synth.stop()

An inline args declaration can set both pfield name and default value:

s = Engine().getSession()
Intr('sine', r'''
    |kamp=0.1, kfreq=1000|
    a0 = oscili:a(kamp, kfreq)
    outch 1, a0
''').register(s)
synth = s.sched('sine', kfreq=440)
synth.stop()

The same can be achieved via an associated table:

s = Engine().getSession()
Intr('sine', r'''
    a0 = oscili:a(kamp, kfreq)
    outch 1, a0
''', tabledef=dict(amp=0.1, freq=1000
).register(s)
synth = s.sched('sine', tabargs=dict(freq=440))
synth.stop()

This will create a table and fill it will the given/default values, generate code to read from the table and free the table after the event is done. Call dump() to see the generated code:

i_params = p4
if ftexists(i_params) == 0 then
    initerror sprintf("params table (%d) does not exist", i_params)
endif
i__paramslen = ftlen(i_params)
if i__paramslen < {maxidx} then
    initerror sprintf("params table too small (size: %d, needed: {maxidx})",
    i__paramslen)
endif
kamp tab 0, i_params
kfreq tab 1, i_params
a0 = oscili:a(kamp, kfreq)
outch 1, a0

An inline syntax exists also for tables:

Intr('sine', r'''
    {amp=0.1, freq=1000}
    a0 = oscili:a(kamp, kfreq)
    outch 1, a0
''')

Functions¶

getSession([name])

Get/create a Session.

Classes¶

Session(name)

Bus(engine[, busnum])

A Bus is used to send/mix audio between instruments to build processing chains.

csoundengine.offline Module¶

This module provides an interface to offline rendering using the same mechanisms as a Session.

Example

from csoundengine import *
renderer = Renderer(sr=44100, nchnls=2)
Instr('saw', r'''
  kmidi = p5
  outch 1, oscili:a(0.1, mtof:k(kfreq))
''').register(renderer)
score = [('saw', 0,   2, 60),
         ('saw', 1.5, 4, 67),
         ('saw', 1.5, 4, 67.1)]
events = [renderer.sched(ev[0], delay=ev[1], dur=ev[2], pargs=ev[3:])
          for ev in score]

# offline events can be modified just like real-time events
renderer.automatep(events[0], 'kmidi', pairs=[0, 60, 2, 59])
renderer.setp(events[1], 3, 'kmidi', 67.2)
renderer.render("out.wav")

Classes¶

Renderer([sr, nchnls, ksmps, a4, …])

A Renderer is used when rendering offline.

ScoreEvent(p1, start, dur, args[, eventId])

A ScoreEvent represent a csound event.

Calls csound with the given args in a subprocess, returns such subprocess.

Similar to get_audiobackends, but returns the names of the backends.

Return a list of supported audio backends as they would be passed to -+rtaudio

getAudioDevices([backend])

Returns (indevices, outdevices), where each of these lists is an AudioDevice.

getDefaultBackend()

Get the default backend for platform, discard any backend which is not available at the moment

Get the default number of channels for a given device

getSamplerateForBackend([backend])

Returns the samplerate reported by the given backend, or 0 if failed

getVersion()

Returns the csound version as tuple (major, minor, patch) so that ‘6.03.0’ is (6, 3, 0)

instrNames(instrdef)

Returns the list of names/instrument numbers in the instrument definition.

Parses the body of the instrument and returns information about pfields used, output channels, etc.

Returns True if the given audio backend is available

matrixAsWav(outfile, mtx, dt[, t0])

Save the data in the 2D matrix mtx as a wav file.

Stretch/Pitchshift a soundfile using csound’s mincer opcode

Returns the power of 2 higher or equal than n
